info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 5:52PM MDT until August 26 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, northwestern Elbert. In northeast Colorado, central Arapahoe and northeastern Douglas.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 552 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Aurora, southeastern Centennial, northern Parker, Bennett, Strasburg, Arapahoe Park and Byers.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Arapahoe, CO; Douglas, CO; Elbert, CO
